title: Joe Mercer | Résumé
description: Joe Mercer: Living in NYC. Working at Noom. School at the University of Waterloo. From Redmond. Tweet @jomrcr. Made by @jomrcr.

info.name: Joe Mercer
info.description: I study Math at the University of Waterloo, I write code for companies (Bazaarvoice, Tagged) and sometimes for myself also. Currently I live in San Francisco, but my whereabouts seem prone to changing frequently

entries.value: Open minded problem solver willing to tackle intimidating problems by exploring new and creative solutions; fond of adventure, be it in thought or practice

Energetic learner quick to make connections between abstract concepts and keen to expand in both breadth and depth; highly adaptable in ever changing technical environments, quick to strike at new opportunities, and adept at finding a niche
Full stack JavaScript engineer and product designer with both personal and professional experience; I take ideas and turn them into reality
University of Waterloo President's Scholarship of Distinction (awarded to students with a minimum 95% entrance average)
First in Class Engineering Scholarship (while in Management Engineering)
Participated in product and design brainstorms for a new feature to help keep Noom users motivated and accountable to their weight loss goals
Prototyped the new feature within Noom's Android application and ran user tests to validate core concepts and leap-of-faith assumptions
Helped build and launch the feature into Noom's Android and iOS apps
Documented the process of using Noom's public data APIs by building a website to help Noom users visualize their data
Shipped code on my first day and on my last
Helped build and launch Tagged's realtime Messaging system (using the XMPP protocol and Ember.js) and Newsfeed application (using AngularJS)
Maintained 95% testing coverage for all shipped code
Planned the implementation strategy for the Tagged.com redesign including the refactor of baseline styles and common components into a LESS framework (extending from Bootstrap)
Championed the restructure of the design team to a distributed model that better integrates with engineering to improve implementation consistency and allow for greater design re-use
Participated in daily stand ups, weekly planning, and biweekly retrospectives
Improved testing coverage by adding unit tests on both the front-end and the back-end
Refactored front-end UI functionality to meet W3C accessibility standards and Node back-end functionality to cleanly interact with a configuration service
Contributed to Bazaarvoice's custom front-end MVC framework (extending from Backbone.js)
Conducted research in the implementation and evaluation of recommendation systems
Collected market research to test the viability of improving recommendation systems by integrating principles from human-computer interaction
